Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
knocker \knock"er\, n. 1. One who, or that which, knocks; specifically, an instrument, or kind of hammer, fastened to a door, to be used in seeking for admittance. [1913 Webster]
Shut, shut the door, good John ! fatigued, I said; Tie up the knocker; say I'm sick, I'm dead. --Pope. [1913 Webster]
2. A person strikingly handsome, beautiful, or fine; one who wins admiration; a ``stunner.'' [Slang.] [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
3. A species of large cockroach, especially {Blabera gigantea}, of semitropical America, which is able to produce a loud knocking sound. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
4. [usually used in pl.] a woman's breast. [vulgar] [PJC]

knocker n 1: (Yiddish) a big shot who knows it and acts that way; a boastful immoderate person 2: a person who knocks (as seeking to gain admittance); "open the door and see who the knocker is" 3: one who disparages or belittles the worth of something [syn: {detractor}, {disparager}, {depreciator}] 4: either of two soft fleshy milk-secreting glandular organs on the chest of a woman [syn: {breast}, {bosom}, {boob}, {tit}, {titty}] 5: a device (usually metal and ornamental) attached by a hinge to a door [syn: {doorknocker}, {rapper}]
